Clark Kent.Action: Is described as mild-mannered and somewhat unaware of his own attractiveness, appearing above vanity.
Absent from the meeting without notice, leaving an empty chair and glass of water behind, missing a critical moment when a bomb threat is announced.
Transforms rapidly into the red and blue blur streaking through the city, moving skillfully and unnoticed by most, showing confidence and ability in his superhero form.
Shakes Sergeant Pennington's hand and politely introduces himself.
Calmly informs that there is no bomb in the building, easing tension.
Uses x-ray vision to scan the building and confidently determines there is no bomb.
Maintains calm and polite demeanor when interacting with Sergeant Pennington despite tense situation.
Superman calmly inspects and disarms a sophisticated bomb quickly and accurately by burning through the correct wires.
Despite confusion from others, Superman demonstrates clear understanding and skill regarding the bomb's mechanism.
Gives Luthor a very dirty look after Luthor makes a sarcastic comment about heartbeats and parties.
Greets Lois Lane cordially and expresses that it's good to see her again despite being in a hurry.
Dismisses Luthor's legal threat without engaging in hostility, choosing to leave promptly.
Hugs his father warmly upon arrival at the family farm.
Shares a quiet, friendly moment with Lana Lang upon greeting her.
Compliments his mother on her cooking after supper.
Offers to help with dishes after supper.
Notices his mother's distant mood and acknowledges family concerns sincerely.
Kisses his father on the forehead and promises to be careful.
Gives mother a long hug and declines leftovers politely.
Gets up and assists with clearing the dishes after supper.
Shows emotional intelligence and awareness by noting his mother's distant mood and responding sensitively.
Promises his father he will be careful, showing responsibility and thoughtfulness.
Declines leftovers politely despite temptation, showing self-control.
Agrees to walk Lana to her car, shows attentiveness and care.
Expresses appreciation and love for his parents.
Acknowledges Lana's feelings and admits he misses her.
Misses the deeper emotional implications Lana tries to express, showing some obliviousness.
Acknowledges the concerns about his safety and capabilities with calm confidence, e.g., stating he had the lava flow under control.
Appears unaware or oblivious to the emotional worries and deeper concerns expressed by Lana, indicating a lack of perceptiveness in interpersonal matters.
Expresses concern about saving strangers and reflects on not knowing anyone in the city he protects.
Admits to saving a billionaire egomaniac instead of being able to save astronauts who died.
Reaches over and holds Lana's hand in a moment of vulnerability and connection.
Expresses regret about not marrying Lana when he had the chance.
Tries to explain himself but is gently stopped and listens.
Not present or active in this excerpt; no demonstrated behavior to judge competence.
Left his disk with a story before leaving at 7 PM for the night, showing responsibility and preparedness.
Does not appear to address or rectify Lois's anger or the missing story disk issue, showing a lack of immediate follow-up or communication.
Insists Lois attend the mayor's meeting to help free up his time and tries to convince her kindly, acknowledging her strengths and offering an exclusive interview as a favor.
Playfully teases Lois about being jealous and about the story competition, maintaining a friendly tone despite underlying tension.
Proposes to Lois to attend the mayor's meeting for him, demonstrating strategic delegation to manage his time effectively.
Calmly handles Lois's jealousy and negotiates an arrangement that benefits both of them, showing social tact and confidence.
Keeps reading the paper while Lois challenges him, initially appearing somewhat dismissive but then engages meaningfully.
Observes the hostage situation calmly and discreetly with concern, positioning himself to help without alarming others.
Uses telescopic vision to identify the thugs and hostages inside the speeding subway train.
Moves behind the line of people and along the platform quietly and strategically toward the train.
Arrives to rescue hostages, takes care to open the train door gently and addresses thugs with calm authority.
Allows a hostage to laugh nervously despite the danger, showing tolerance for frightened behavior.
Spares and gently incapacitates thugs rather than harming them, showing restraint and kindness.
Calms a frightened thug by returning a hot bullet to his hand, showing mercy and sincerity.
Refuses to take a photo with a little girl but offers her a meaningful souvenir instead, engaging kindly on her level.
Stops a speeding truck by pressing his hand against it, preventing harm to the driver and bystanders.
Calmly handles the violent perp, demanding an apology and ensuring the perpetrator is handcuffed and secured without escalating the situation.
At the press conference, Clark Kent's attention drifts and he struggles to focus amid overlapping distractions.
Leaves the press room quietly without drawing attention when called on to answer a question.
Moves swiftly and silently to save people by entering an elevator shaft unnoticed to transform into Superman.
Uses his strength and vision to stop a runaway monorail and prevent a collision.
Exhibits strained effort and determination under extreme physical pressure.
No direct action or statement attributed to Clark Kent in the excerpt.
Lois instinctively hands him a box of tissue when he sneezes, and Clark thanks her politely.
Says he is feeling under the weather and decides to go home and rest, showing consideration for others by stepping away rather than staying sick at work.
Hands Jimmy a letter to mail before leaving, showing trust and friendly interaction.
Acknowledges feeling unwell and decides to go home to rest rather than push through sickness at work.
Delegates the task of mailing the letter to Jimmy before leaving, showing responsible task management despite feeling ill.
Does not engage in the banter or distraction about Metallo or other newsroom chatter, focusing instead on his own wellbeing and duties.
Corrects Lois about the family recipe being seven generations, showing attention to detail and knowledge.
Responds promptly and professionally when called by Perry White, showing readiness and responsibility.
Helps old lady Hayworth across the street, demonstrating kindness.
Maintains honesty, trustworthiness, and moral behavior.
Behaves in an overly proper and perhaps socially awkward manner (no smoking, drinking, swearing, calls parents daily, etc.).
Helps old lady Hayworth across the street despite her being known as cranky.
Warmly greets and hugs Diana, an old friend, and introduces her kindly to colleagues.
Is described as by-the-book moral and excellent worker, implying sincerity and trustworthiness.
Described as by-the-book moral, excellent worker, great writer.
Greets and introduces Diana confidently, showing social ease and leadership.
Sees an old friend and reacts excitedly and warmly, demonstrating emotional intelligence.
Invites Diana to a picnic at a special place outside the city, showing thoughtfulness and consideration.
Shares family photos and gently interacts with Diana, showing openness and sincerity.
Embarrassed about his parents not knowing Diana's holiday preferences, tries to handle it lightly, indicating sensitivity.
Shows social confidence by smoothly managing introduction and departure with Diana, responding promptly when ready.
Displays emotional intelligence and tact in conversation, gently teasing Diana about holiday cards rather than confronting awkwardness.
Prepares a thoughtful outing with Diana, demonstrating planning and considerate behavior.
Expresses fear of failing others but remains committed to high standards and responsibility.
Acknowledges and appreciates having someone who understands him, showing openness and sincerity.
Expresses fear of failure but maintains commitment to high standards and responsibility.
Admits vulnerability and uncertainty during a moment of pressure.
Immediately awakens and attentively tunes into the emergency news broadcast upon hearing a crisis announcement.
Enters the nuclear core to manually force the fail-safe shields back into place, risking radiation exposure to prevent disaster.
Despite seeming physical distress or near collapse, successfully completes the task to avert the disaster.
Expresses immediate concern for the safety of others after awakening weakly in hospital.
As Superman, safely returns to consciousness and immediately inquires about the safety of others, demonstrating awareness and priority of responsibility despite weakness.
Fails to remember how he got to the hospital, showing momentary confusion or disorientation.
Gently catches Lana Lang when she leaps from balcony with no concern for safety; carries her inside; politely asks to stay with her for a while.
Leaves Star Labs abruptly despite being weak and requested to stay for tests.
Admits feeling incompetent after a crisis, showing vulnerability and openness.
Motions Lana not to reveal his presence to his mother, protecting her feelings and the situation.
Does not insist on staying with Lana despite her suggestion, possibly avoiding burdening her.
Admits feeling incompetent after Superman was incapacitated and expresses self-doubt to Lana Lang.
Attempts to stay hidden to avoid worry and complications for his mother, showing prudence in handling personal information.
Demonstrates internal conflict about lying to his mother and Lana about his situation, indicating emotional struggle but thoughtful decision-making.
Argues passionately for Metropolis to embrace future technology and take responsibility for safety rather than relying on Superman.
Greets the market owner warmly and sincerely, appreciating the effort to get the Daily Planet to Kansas.
Keeps his visit a surprise from his parents, respecting their privacy.
Joins Lana in singing and engages with her in a playful, friendly manner despite being shy.
Sings playfully and loosens up with Lana, carries groceries inside without being asked.
Carries groceries inside without being asked, shows awareness of the news situation.
Loosens up while singing with Lana, demonstrating some social ease and confidence.
Does not immediately respond to the dangerous Metallo situation on live TV, continues in a casual manner with Lana.
Leans in and gives Lana a long passionate kiss before rushing off to help others.
Responds to Lana's question about why it always has to be him by saying 'Because I'm the only one who can.'
Recognizes the urgency of the situation and decisively states he must leave immediately to handle the crisis.
Demonstrates confidence in his unique capability by stating 'Because I'm the only one who can.'
Uses heat vision effectively to burn Metallo's metallic skin, displaying tactical skill and knowledge of enemy weaknesses.
Continues to engage Metallo despite knowing the presence of kryptonite within him, demonstrating courage but also potential recklessness.
Examines the map and identifies that there is nothing radioactive in the specified areas, demonstrating analytical skills and attention to detail.
Does not explain or clarify the scientific terms himself, allowing confusion among others without stepping in to assist.

Quietly whispers a strategic taunt to Metallo and confidently removes the kryptonite, then uses heat vision tactically to expose Metallo and destroy his cover, leading to Metallo being trapped and defeated.
Continues to confront Metallo despite being repeatedly slammed, knocked down, and shot at, showing perseverance and determination to stop the threat.
Maintains composure and does not flinch after being hit hard by Metallo.
Skillfully counters Metallo's attacks, incinerates his arm with heat vision, and disarms him.
Shows physical stamina and tactical awareness in battle against a dangerous opponent.
Loses some control and appears furious, which could indicate a momentary lapse in emotional regulation.
Confronts Lex Luthor firmly and gains entry despite security objections, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Appears beaten and clothes torn but still controls the situation without hesitation.
Accepts legal authority and follows due process by responding to the deputization and arrest command calmly and cooperatively.
Remains silent and does not directly respond to Lex Luthor's provocations during the confrontation.
Maintains a stern, watchful demeanor when confronting Luthor, showing control and presence of mind.
Responds to a threatening situation with calmness rather than rashness, demonstrating confidence and intelligence.
Efficiently retrieves and reads a thank-you note left for Superman, indicating attentiveness and appreciation, though not a direct indicator of skill.
Uses telescopic vision to quickly inspect the bomb held by the woman.
Calmly interprets the chaotic sounds he hears to identify the woman with the bomb.
Uses knowledge of heart rhythms to locate a bomb and explain his method intelligently to others.
Responds to Luthor's threats and legal warnings with calm dismissal and quickly departs without hesitation.
Uses telescopic vision to identify thugs and hostages from a distance before taking action.
Transitions quickly and skillfully from Clark Kent to Superman and enters the subway tunnel at high speed, squeezing between the train and tunnel wall while matching turns without slowing.
Breaks open the train doors by force with precise control.
Maintains calm and control in a hostile environment despite multiple gunfire, catching dozens of bullets effortlessly.
Catches dozens of bullets effortlessly and disables a thug's weapon skillfully by crinkling it until it smokes and breaks apart.
Anticipates and reacts instantly to a gunshot from behind, catching the bullet mid-air and returning it to the attacker without harm.
Interacts warmly and thoughtfully with a little girl by creating a harmless souvenir (encasing bullets in ice) that provides a meaningful connection without compromising his identity.
Gives a frozen bullet to a little girl and encourages her to share the story, making her happy.
Responds kindly and appreciatively to the girl's father's thanks.
Conceals the injury from Lois, assuring her he's fine despite obvious pain, showing concern to not worry her.
Calmly interacts with the public by freezing bullets and giving one to a little girl, maintaining composure despite injury.
Conceals his injury initially, assuring Lois he is fine despite visible burns, showing control and judgment.
Discreetly leaves the press room unnoticed and skillfully navigates a dangerous elevator shaft by freefalling and transforming into Superman, demonstrating confidence, planning, and physical control.
Admits feeling distant and troubled about nearly failing to save people on a train.
Shares his vulnerability about fearing death while emphasizing the value of saving lives.
Responds immediately to a crisis by transforming into Superman and intervening to help evacuate people and handle the nuclear reactor threat.
Jokingly dismisses the supervisor's detailed explanation of the science behind the reactor ('I really haven't got time for the science lesson').
Manually forces fail-safe shields back into place inside a hazardous nuclear core to prevent disaster and save lives.
Leaves the lab despite being weak and needing further tests, prioritizing his own judgment over others' advice.
Attempts to fly and move despite physical weakness, showing determination to fulfill his role.
Seeks refuge and emotional support with Lana Lang, acknowledging his limitations and need for rest.
Politely interacts with the market owner, corrects a minor misunderstanding confidently.
Keeps his surprise visit to Smallville secret from his parents, showing discretion and planning.
Sings badly along with Lana, showing some social awkwardness but willingness to engage.

Uses freezing breath to turn sewer water into ice to hinder Metallo, showing tactical use of powers and situational awareness.
Appears visibly weak during the fight, allowing Metallo to break free and continue attacking.
